<br />
3/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1969052"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1969052#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1967382" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1967382" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Brender"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869984"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1869984.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Brender" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1967382ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1967382" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869984">Brender</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 23:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a nice floral scent. Some citrus as well, but that's every fresh fragrance. It's a luxurious and professional scent, may be brand bias though. Simple and pleasant and works any day of the summer depending on your associations with flowers, I like the review below mentioning it smelling like a church.<br />
<br />
I enjoy it a lot and it's a no-brainer. But for the price it just doesn't do much; not complex and the performance is about as good as rubbing your skin with actual flowers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1967382"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1967382#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1962114" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1962114" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AUyliong"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1859277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1859277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AUyliong" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1962114ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1962114" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1859277">AUyliong</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-27">10/27/23 07:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrus laced white florals. It's kinda amazing that the citrus holds on as long as it does (2hrs in I still smell them) HOWEVER this is a predominantly white floral frag. The citri (?) are bit players lending the white flowers zest and tang. <br />
<br />
So if you like white florals and smelling like a church during a wedding or a funeral this is for you. If you're a citrus lover and think this will be citrus forward you'll be disappointed.<br />
<br />
Oh and sillage and longevity are as bad as others describe. Became a skin scent as it dried down and at the rate it's fading I est 3-4 hrs life max. <br />
<br />
Masculine leaning unisex in the beginning. Becomes feminine leaning after the white florals take over.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1962114"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1962114#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961008" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961008" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hal_kreisel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1866023"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1866023.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hal_kreisel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1825.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Vanille"title="Tobacco Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961008ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961008" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1866023">hal_kreisel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-25">10/25/23 22:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For a citrus freshy, this is about as good as you could ask for longevity and performance.<br />
<br />
Over 8 hours on the skin while performing a physical job. Silage is not particularly powerful, but makes for a beautiful and intimate scent that can be enjoyed for any occasion.<br />
<br />
The scent is gorgeous, layered, and luxe.<br />
For this category of fragrance, you cant really get any better. 10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1961008"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1961008#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1943627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1943627" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Titiana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1651375"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Titiana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1943627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1943627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1651375">Titiana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-03">10/03/23 20:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is very luxurious scent. It has to be the ingredients quality and the composition. I really tried to make it last longer with molecules, but it makes it cheap, and all the magic disappears at once. Just enjoy it as it is, its gorgeous. Im a big neroli oil fan, love it so much</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1943627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1943627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1941000" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="millyb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1436969"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="millyb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1941000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1941000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1436969">millyb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-30">09/30/23 08:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Neroli Portofino is a complicated first smell. It seems straightforward--refreshing--but there are immediately layers that you can't quite put your finger on. It makes me feel luxurious... like I'm laying under the sun in the eponymous Italian landscape.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1941000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1941000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1938566" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1938566" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kyotokko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1812961"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1812961.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kyotokko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Tobacco-Collection-Intense-Dark-Exclusive-2021-69135.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69135.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Collection Intense Dark Exclusive 2021"title="Tobacco Collection Intense Dark Exclusive 2021"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1938566ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1938566" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1812961">Kyotokko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-27">09/27/23 07:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently tried out the Perfume Neroli Portofino by Tom Ford, and I must admit it is quite a luxurious scent. Compared to 4711, it has a similarly clean, refreshing, and joyous undertone, which I found to be quite intriguing, making it a great gift for someone special. Unfortunately, it is rather pricey compared to 4711, which you can buy litres of for the same price as Neroli Portofino. On the other hand, Tom Ford's Neroli Sauvage is a much more unique take on the neroli scent, albeit also pricey. Nevertheless, Neroli Portofino is a very pleasant, indulgent, and energising scent that overall is worth the extra cost for a special occasion.<br />
<br />
I almost always try this at the perfumery just to get a good laugh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1938566"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1938566#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1938057" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1938057" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cowboy87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1833290"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cowboy87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1938057ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1938057" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1833290">Cowboy87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-26">09/26/23 16:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells of citrus mostly and sunscreen. I don't mean that negatively...its well blended and high quality ingredients. As with most all citrus fragrances, the performance is poor 3 hours. Great warm weather or vacation scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1938057"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1938057#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1936717" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1936717" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="linga_jang"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1847516"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1847516.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="linga_jang" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1936717ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1936717" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1847516">linga_jang</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-25">09/25/23 02:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hate price love scent<br />
But too weak and short<br />
Korean girls like this</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1936717"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1936717#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1935307" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1935307" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scissorslizardspock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1026213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scissorslizardspock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Henry-Rose/Blonde-Barry-83558.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83558.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blonde Barry"title="Blonde Barry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1935307ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1935307" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213">Scissorslizardspock</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-23">09/23/23 07:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Overpriced?  Yes.  Overrated?  Not in my opinion.  Ive tried (what feels like) every Neroli-Cologne type fragrance ever made and this is the one I love.  The heart wants what the heart wants.  <br />
<br />
Its not a dupe for 4711, although very similar, NP is just more fuller, longer lasting, more well rounded.  Its happy, refreshing, uplifting, beautiful.  <br />
<br />
I have loved and repurchased Neroli Portofino for quite a few years now. It is my most re-purchased fragrance.  I wear Neroli Portofino in warmer weather usually, for a workout, run, walk, hike, top-down Jeep adventure, beach walk, outdoor yoga, even early morning work.  Its motivating and refreshing.  Ive used it so often for workout related times, that it now has a Pavlovian effect on my brain.  I spray NP and feel the need to run or hike or swim, lol.  <br />
<br />
I do find NP to be similar to Chanels Paris-Riviera (which I also love), but NP is less dense, has more of a green citrus airiness.  As for all the other beautiful Neroli colognes out there, yes - there are affordable beauties available - but this is THE ONE for me.  <br />
<br />
PS - this layers really well with Bum Bum Cream or 4711 body products or even with TF Soleil Blanc.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1935307"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1935307#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1926058" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Reminds me of classic Italian cologne casually worn by a true Italian gentleman. But it is unisex as well. People complaining about the performance. Lol, I get 7 hours with four sprays on back of neck!  I get beautiful wafts throughout the day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1926058"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1926058#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1925776" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The ingredients smell fresh, nothing artificial. If doesnt last very long, so I over spay the hell out of this when I wear it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1922679"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1922679#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1922382" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1922382" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bil00l"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1727415"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bil00l" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Noir-Extreme-Parfum-75489.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75489.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Noir Extreme Parfum"title="Noir Extreme Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1922382ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1922382" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1727415">bil00l</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-07">09/07/23 18:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great perfume, perfect for a summer occasion but I wouldn't wear this every day because it's so expensive. Lovely citrusy and floral opening with a great sweet flowery dry down, and it does so without being a feminine perfume. I would say that it is perfectly unisex, no obvious marks of a typical "manly" perfume and no typical feminine traits either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1922382"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1922382#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1914497" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1825975">juliet.3m</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-29">08/29/23 11:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>my boyfriend bought this at the beginning of summer, and I like it on him when we go out for daytime dates. It is very hot where we live so it smells very refreshing, cool, and citrusy during the summer. Because it is so expensive, I decided to start wearing it casually since it cost too much to rarely be worn. It smells different on my skin than on his and I actually love it. It gives me a very fresh and aquatic luxury smell and it surprisingly lasts longer on me (3-4 hrs) than it does on my bf (1-2hrs for him).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Fresh, Sweet, Floral &amp; Citrusy. Average longevity and silage, but the 2 hours of wear I get from it are absolutely worth it. Quintessential summer fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1898575"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1898575#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1897823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1897823" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LostSock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1500461"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1500461.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LostSock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-pour-Homme-2003-691.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.691.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci pour Homme (2003)"title="Gucci pour Homme (2003)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1897823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1897823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1500461">LostSock</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 08:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of few TF fragrances I actively dislike. Some I just don't particularly get along with, but can still see the appeal, but not this. The opening is horrible, it reminds me of nothing but insanely cheap Citrus scented air fresheners. Then it's gone, totally gone. No dry down, no Neroli, just gone. The pricing of this is just insane considering the low quality of the avgyil scent, plus the abject longevity.<br />
<br />
If people are looking for a a Tom Ford citrus based fragrance, they'd be much better off going with Mandarino Di Amalfi or the Acqua flanker. That's got a much nicer, far more natural smelling citrus note. It still doesn't last all that long, but you're talking hours, not minutes.<br />
<br />
I'll praise Oud Wood and Lost Cherry until the cows come home and always think both are well worth their retail price - this stuff however gets blown out of the water by dozens of citrus scents, some as little as 10% of the price of this. I'm not even mentioning Neroli scents as I yet zero from this, that's after multiple tests and 8 weeks maceration of my bottle. I'd have been better off getting one of the clones I think, most reviewers tend to rate those more highly and state they have much better performance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1897823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1897823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1896153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1896153" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Matin mo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1790244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1790244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Matin mo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1896153ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1896153" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1790244">Matin mo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-07">08/07/23 07:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>                  .<br />
            (     )             .<br />
                    .<br />
        .<br />
******************************************<br />
scent:6/10<br />
longevity:8/10<br />
sillage:6/10<br />
purchase value:2/10<br />
***********<br />
overall:5.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1896153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1896153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1895754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1803137">Liliana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-29">07/29/23 20:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really love the initial lemon and orange scent; it brings me a pleasant feeling, making it perfect for using during summer beach trips. However, the fragrance dissipates too quickly; even on a scent strip, it barely lasts for more than an hour before it becomes difficult to detect. This makes me very concerned about its longevity when sprayed on my skin. And then, there's the old issue: the price is just too high.<br />
<br />
Smell : 7/10 - ok<br />
Performance : 6.5/10 - Normal<br />
Uniqueness : 6.5/10 <br />
Longevity : Very weak, On my skin may be less than 30mins.<br />
Sillage : Weak<br />
Value : 3/10 - Way overpriced<br />
Personal score : 6.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1890160"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1890160#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889730" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1886829" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Moshikoko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1717798"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1717798.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Moshikoko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boadicea-the-Victorious/Golden-Aries-31447.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31447.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Golden Aries"title="Golden Aries"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1886829ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1886829" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1717798">Moshikoko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-25">07/25/23 13:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know about you, <br />
this perfume stays on me for 6-7 hours. <br />
And the smell? <br />
So good! <br />
<br />
8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1886829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1886829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1882545" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1882545" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bois-1920/Itruk-32129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Itruk"title="Itruk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1882545ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1882545" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-19">07/19/23 17:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#175 in my "Tour de Fragrance"<br />
Tom Ford's "Neroli Portofino"<br />
A Few Significant Moments<br />
<br />
Like most consumers I had no clue that testers were part of a calculated "bait and switch" that lured you in with airy, volatile, quickly diffused top notes that you were never going to smell on your skin 15 minutes later. I didn't know what those in the know knew that the trick to buying a great fragrance was to spray it on, shop for two hours, hit the food court, then smell your skin to learn how the scent will actually perform throughout the day, before returning to the fragrance counter. Like a lot of naive men, I bought whatever the beautiful young woman at the counter told me would smell great on me (and get them the best commission). I don't blame them. Educating me was not their job.<br />
<br />
Before I undertook this journey, I knew nothing about the fragrance pyramid, certainly not that citrus oils are among the most volatile and ephemeral of the perfumer's arsenal, or that a citrus opening was not a promise of lasting fruity delight, but a false promise on which no perfume delivers. No matter how much you pay for the scent, that citrus opening won't last through a short morning commute, let alone till morning coffee break, so it's really important that there are bottom notes you enjoy and are enjoyable to others, as an hour after you apply the scent, those bottom notes are what will remain, with luck some middle notes, but those freshie notes of the opening will be long gone. <br />
<br />
This scent, Neroli Portofino, is a perfect example of a citrus-forward scent that will entice you on a test strip and disappoint you on your skin and does so at lightning speed. I've had the identical experience with all of Acqua di Parma's citrus scents, Mancera Sicily, the list goes on and on, and those among you with deep experience at this game are no doubt bemused by neophyte reviews bemoaning the short lifespan of top notes like bergamot, neroli, lemon, lime, orange and grapefruit, because you know that's to be expected. You probably find reviews based on smelling a test strip for ten seconds a real belly laugh. <br />
<br />
I consider this fragrance, which is pretty much all citrus top and no bottom, a complete waste of anyone's money. And this one, sold at a Tom Ford price of $185 and up, is an especially grievous waste of money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1882545"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1882545#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880236" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880236" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dreamingonthemoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1793882"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1793882.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dreamingonthemoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880236ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880236" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1793882">dreamingonthemoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-16">07/16/23 15:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Although this is a male leaning fragrance I absolutely adore it. More feminine citrus scents have this unbearable synthetic aspect and I find more masculine ones to be fresher. It wears better on skin than on tester paper, very fresh and a bit soapy but always pleasant to catch whiffs of throughout the day. My skin is a magnet for fragrance so the longevity has never been an issue, but I can understand why it would be frustrating considering the pricepoint.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1880236"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1880236#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1879059" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1879059" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="orvn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1578297"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="orvn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1879059ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1879059" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1578297">orvn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-15">07/15/23 02:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Super short lasting, price is totaly unadecvate to this and just a simple calculation that for actaul prices of 100ml of Neroli Portofino You could buy 6333 ml of 4711 kolnisch wasser and keep bottle with You to spray time to time. Duboiz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777511"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1777511.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="John C. Duboiz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1863694ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1863694" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777511">John C. Duboiz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-24">06/24/23 13:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrus white floral freshy scent what the slight hint of green soapiness. Contrary to popular consensus, this isn't all that similar to 4711 in my opinion. TFNP is more white floral soapy clean, 4711 is more citrus. What they do both have in common: longevity is close to none! TFNP has a little better performance, but that's like being the tallest kid in kindergarten. <br />
I really love the smell but I'm underwhelmed by the performance; not to mention, the ridiculous asking price has me dumbfounded. I'm not sure why they decided to include this in TF's private line.<br />
If you want a great alternative for a fraction of the price, try Maison Alhambra's Porto Neroli. It's not only a great clone, but a much better performing fragrance as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1863694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1863694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1863147" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1860167" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="flem"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.14736.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="flem" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Theodoros-Kalotinis/Alluring-Fig-68196.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68196.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alluring Fig"title="Alluring Fig"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1860167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1860167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); Unfortunately, that doesn't last long (enough). Before the hour is up the scent just becomes pure powdery flowers. Not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1860167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1860167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1857474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1857474" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Arber Cami"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/102830"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.102830.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Arber Cami" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pigmentarium/Genesis-74523.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74523.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Genesis"title="Genesis"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1857474ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1857474" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/102830">Arber Cami</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-15">06/15/23 23:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Where to start...criminally overpriced for the quality you get, the smell is dead simple and a copy of 4711 Cologne/Turkish cologne. Also for the  outrageous price you get mediocre quality (longevity max 3 hours) and a cheap smelling mess. If you like Neroli Portofino I would suggest buying a few liters of '4711' or 'Porto Neroli from Maison Alhambra' and spray yourself 25.000times.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1857474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1857474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1857471" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1857471" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ToastyMonroe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1688249"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1688249.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ToastyMonroe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1857471ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1857471" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1688249">ToastyMonroe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-15">06/15/23 23:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this as I always liked the bottle design and colour and as a huge Tom Ford fan I didnt think it would disappoint. It is very familliar on the nose to Basil and Neroli by Jo Malone (but of course it is, its the neroli). <br />
<br />
Unfortunately not for my tastes, but I loved the citrus smell. It reminds me of my mother and warm summer days by the poolside.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1857471"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1857471#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1855114" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1855111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1855111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1855087" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1855087" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="d00dster"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1353254"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1353254.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="d00dster" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12192.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Neroli Portofino"title="Neroli Portofino"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1855087ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1855087" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1353254">d00dster</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-12">06/12/23 23:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is great stuff.  I just had a funny story about it.  I love Bvlgari Man Wood Neroli, and a year or so ago I heard it was going out of stock, and I freaked and bought a few sealed backup bottles.<br />
<br />
Anyways, it's finally warming up here, I gotta reintroduce myself to my warmer weather fragrances, I have probably 2/3 cold weather, but hey, it's still in the 40F range at night here.  I went to visit my parents for dinner, and did Neroli Portofino on one wrist, and Bvlgari Man Wood Neroli on the other.  I think they are both great, and pretty similar, though the TF lasts longer.  My mom loved the TF Neroli far more, and my dad thought the Bvlgari was way better.<br />
<br />
Olfactory senses are funny.  I don't even have a list of any summer frags I want to get that I don't have, maybe D&amp;G Light Blue Forever or Italian Love, Maybe Terre d'Hermes Eau Givree, I don't know.  I can still pass with light sprays with cooler weather frags lightly at night here.  Anyways, I'm 35, and it was funny my parents both picked different neroli scents.  OH, I really wanna get some of the ADG Parfum, I forgot to get a bottle of Profumo for years, and I think this will be even better, no magnetic cap, but that is one cool bottle.  I'm in love with the EDP, so if the parfum is basically a refined Profumo, it should be awesome.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1855087"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1855087#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1854191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1854191" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahlage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614575"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1614575.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahlage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Si-Passione-48002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="S Passione"title="S Passione"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1854191ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1854191" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614575">sarahlage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-11">06/11/23 15:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's genuinely incredible fresh and summery. Soleil Blanc seems to be advertised as THE Tom Ford summer scent, but I feel that Neroli Portofino hits the mark even more effectively. Truly unisex, bright, and almost aquatic on me. Huge love! Added to my wishlist.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1854191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1854191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1850344" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; (babys perfume)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1850344"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1850344#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1849562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1849562" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LayAmanda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1457831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1457831.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LayAmanda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1849562ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1849562" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1457831">LayAmanda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-05">06/05/23 09:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It reminds me of Maldives and exotic luxury resort.<br />
in terms of it has not only fresh and clean vibes but also luxury with light mood, so I can rate this fragrance as 8.5 out of 10(if it were last longer, then it would be 10. Since its performance is quite poor.).<br />
<br />
It is unique citrus-floral scent which is not so typical and stale. Although it had been released about 12 years ago, it seems its value is still noticeable for its fame.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1849562"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1849562#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1849508" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1849508" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Parfumpop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1566092"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1566092.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Parfumpop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfumane/Sacred-Palace-79324.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79324.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sacred Palace"title="Sacred Palace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1849508ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1849508" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1566092">Parfumpop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-05">06/05/23 07:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is a weakness for me.<br />
The structure of the notes is quite simple. However, it exudes a fresh and clean quality, making it easy to wear. Neroli Portofino does not surprise with its uniqueness, but offers a relaxing and safe olfactory experience in a working environment.<br />
<br />
With a medium-strong scent, the perfume reflects a calm and peaceful atmosphere with a slight sense of cleanliness. If you are looking for something flashy, this may not be an ideal choice.<br />
<br />
I have made this the signature scent of summer and my wife finds it particularly attractive on me. Thanks to her liking for this fragrance, I can wear it with ease.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1849508"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1849508#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1848095" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
