Lol.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1837825"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1837825#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1835589" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1835589" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MarieLlwyd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1663270"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1663270.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MarieLlwyd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Rodriguez-for-Him-Bleu-Noir-31247.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31247.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Rodriguez for Him Bleu Noir"title="Narciso Rodriguez for Him Bleu Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1835589ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1835589" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1663270">MarieLlwyd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-17">05/17/23 15:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My first serious fragrance purchase (discounting Fahrenheit and Le Male from my twenties in the late eighties!<br />
<br />
I purchased it on a flight home from either Lisbon or Berlin. Cant recall which. Years ago. Id previously caught a whiff of it somewhere and the bottle is pretty memorable so I saw it and splurged the cash in a post-holiday euphoria.<br />
<br />
I still love it - despite expanding my fragrance experiences since. Tom Ford fragrances are of the highest quality. Thats why theyre expensive. If you think theyre too expensive then dont buy. Nobody is forcing you. Most people would acknowledge they are palpably superior to most others.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1835589"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1835589#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1835556" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1835556" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ekuhar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1752096"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1752096.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ekuhar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1835556ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1835556" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1752096">ekuhar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-17">05/17/23 14:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I came here to defend this gorgeous fragrance.<br />
Yes, it is waaay overpriced, but it is just how it goes with Tom Ford. <br />
If we leave that aside;<br />
This beautiful blend manages to be at the same time: fresh and clean, assertive and dominant, nostalgic - evoking memories of your summer in the Mediterranean gardens, and sensual.<br />
It is strong, powerful, bold, but at the same time young, fun and seducing.<br />
It doesnt have a sillage, yes, but that is just as it should be - as fragrances heavy like this one should be intimate. A huge cloud around you of a scent like this would be too much.<br />
What is interesting, its not that this fragrance smells good in a normal way that one would imagine a good perfume should. Actually this special scent drunks you into just wanting more. Ive got some huge compliments with it.<br />
Its not a blind buy, and its not for everyone. Dupes just dont cut it for me; they might be similar, neroli, citrus whatever, but none has this effect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1835556"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1835556#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1835202" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its crowd pleasing but they did well with how they blended the fresh white floral and neroli. Everybody well balanced apart from those two notes. Anyone can rock this. Nothing groundbreaking about it. <br />
But I find them, well...meh. I know there's better interpretations done by similar perfumers and by cheaper brands.<br />
<br />
For me I prefer to wear 47111 with some Iso E Super and save the money for some exquisite gin, rum or cocktails in the summer...6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Elegant, clean, I dare to say relaxing scent. Very European. Lacks depth in my humble opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1818093"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1818093#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1815986" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1815986" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KerriZ"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1506615"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1506615.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KerriZ" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1815986ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1815986" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1506615">KerriZ</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-23">04/23/23 19:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Absolutely one of my absolute favorite scents. It is the perfect blend of white florals and fresh citrus. Neroli for days!  Takes me on an exhilarating top down drive on the Cote D'Azur midday. sun shining. warm breeze hitting my face. Heat toasting my bare shoulders. Don't tell anyone but sometimes I wear it to go to sleep. I love the transfer to my pillowcase that lasts for days. Lulls me into a sweet dream.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1815986"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1815986#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1814746" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1814746" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="miyawakiri"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521606"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1521606.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="miyawakiri" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1814746ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1814746" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521606">miyawakiri</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-22">04/22/23 05:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>literally smells like citrusy flowery wet wipes. its refreshing for sure but i feel like this scent is masculine rather than feminine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1814746"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1814746#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1814454" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1814454" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sheherazad"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716680"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1716680.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sheherazad" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Elixir-Pour-Femme-Parfum-53130.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53130.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir Pour Femme Parfum "title="Elixir Pour Femme Parfum "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1814454ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1814454" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716680">Sheherazad</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-21">04/21/23 16:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Can a fragrance be both beautifully distinctive &amp; completely quotidian? This lovely fragrance is. Sparkly, tart, effervescent citrus notes squirt beautifully across lush, blooming florals invoking long summer days of  youth when all you had to do was wake up, get dressed, and dash outside to play. No school, no chores, just months of happy-go-lucky Summer sunshine. Trips to the beach, bicycle rides, chasing the ice cream truck. But doing it all in the Mediterranean, then cleaning ice cream off your face w/ lemon-scented wet wipes.   </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1814454"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1814454#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1813500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1813500" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Asfand"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708102"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1708102.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Asfand" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1813500ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1813500" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708102">Asfand</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-20">04/20/23 11:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Qaa'ed<br />
gandrasta01/08/23 02:36<br />
<br />
Um, this is straight 4711 in fancy bottle. Great for summer hot day, but don't expect depth and sophisticated layers though. It screams Mediterranean out loud</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1813500"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1813500#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1807962" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1807962" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Granny Autismo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Granny Autismo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Kalan-56036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kalan"title="Kalan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1807962ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1807962" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678715">Granny Autismo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-13">04/13/23 13:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can see why one would compare this to cleaning products, since it shares a few aroma chemicals that are used in cleaning products. Be that as it may, it doesn't bother me at all. This composition is perfect as an elegant signature summer scent for the poised bois out there. It doesn't focus too much on the citrus, which is a relief since I don't like fragrances that are too citrus heavy. Furthermore, neroli is my favourite white flower and it smells really masculine, especially in this fragrance. <br />
<br />
The opening is pleasantly neroli-heavy, and the citruses are the 2nd most prominent note. I really like the touch of rosemary and lavender in the opening, but the myrtle is not at all prominent though still detectable. The drydown mainly smells like angelica and a complex bouquet of clean (i.e. non-animalic) musks, but I don't quite detect any amber. And oddly enough, it smells a little bit aquatic to me in the drydown, so either my nose is broken or there's dihydromyrcenol or something similar in here. Anyways, I was hoping for better performance, given the presence of amber and musks (which serve as fixatives), but they went light on the musks and I could barely detect any amber at all. Maybe it was stronger in an earlier formulation, but Tom Ford prices and marketing are infamously wack, so I guess there's nothing that can be done besides going harder on the sprays. On the topic of sprays, I'd suggest spraying 5 times. I tried 3 sprays before in 25C weather, and no one (myself included) could smell jacksh*t. 5 sprays seems to be an inoffensively detectable amount for me, but I wouldn't say my skin chemistry particularly promotes sillage, so take my advice with a grain of salt.    <br />
<br />
All in all, I really love this fragrance, which is partly due to the memories I associate with it. It reminds me personally of going to the beach in Hong Kong summer where it was 35C at noon. But personal attachment aside, this fragrance was masterfully created and serves as a great, inoffensive, sophisticated, elegant signature scent. Although I would deem this a safe blind buy, many people seem to disagree under the belief that it smells like cleaning products or baby wipes. Also, I don't think this smells very similar to mandarino di amalfi, despite both being citrus/white-floral/aromatic fragrances, and between those two I prefer neroli portofino. But, if you prefer more citrus and less white florals, maybe go with mandarino di amalfi instead. Both are professional signature-worthy fragrances. <br />
<br />
Scent: 9/10<br />
Season and time of day: Preferably summer days, but spring days work fine too <br />
Gender: Masculine <br />
Longevity: Moderate (6 hrs with 5 sprays)<br />
Sillage: Intimate (This is a skin scent which can only be detected from like 1 foot away)<br />
Price value: Extremely overpriced (extortionately exorbitant for the performance it offers)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1807962"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1807962#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1807446" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1807446" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Anelette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1726854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Anelette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1807446ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1807446" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1726854">Anelette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-12">04/12/23 22:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought it as a birthday present for myself  in 2021.<br />
The best Neroli scent (Ive tested many) for me- elegant, fresh, different. Perfect for summer holidays and whats the most- it doesnt start annoying me. <br />
It was very difficult to find something light for the summer; TF does its job. Agree- a bit overpriced, but I absolutely love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1807446"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1807446#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1805042" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1805042" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Deliciosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136230"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1136230.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Deliciosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Elegantly-Tokyo-70527.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70527.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elegantly Tokyo"title="Elegantly Tokyo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1805042ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1805042" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136230">Deliciosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-10">04/10/23 01:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got a decant of Neroli Portofino. It smells like the Nenuco Agua de Colonia fragrance used for 95% of babies in Spain: a neroli explosion. But even if Neroli Portofino performs better than Nenuco, it still doesn't justify the price difference (Nenuco's longevity is not much worse).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1805042"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1805042#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1800470" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1800470" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jlog23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555933"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555933.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jlog23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1800470ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1800470" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555933">jlog23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-04">04/04/23 13:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrus, florally, baby wipes. The moist towelettes you receive after a meal. The wet wipes used to clean your countertops. Obviously more luxurious and less astringent than that, but this has that nauseating cleaning product smell that is associated with those items. Its a pass for me, especially for the price point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1800470"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1800470#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799018" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799018" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mjchaelj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1330577.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mjchaelj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Trudon/Absolu-96547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Absolu"title="Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799018ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799018" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330577">Mjchaelj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-02">04/02/23 19:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very nice, Ive only tried the Acqua version before and this is much richer and better performing. It reminds me of picking oranges as a kid in Santa Barbara. The rinds, the leaves, everything. The quality is fantastic, nothing cheap here. Fresh fragrances arent my favorite but this one is really nice. <br />
<br />
8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1799018"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1799018#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1794342" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1794342" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pug_pug2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632423"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1632423.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pug_pug2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Sedley-56273.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56273.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sedley"title="Sedley"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1794342ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1794342" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632423">pug_pug2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-27">03/27/23 21:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I blind bought a 100ml bottle and it is nice Fresh white floral. really  nice scent for summertime  and pretty bottle<br />
but very redundant in my collection.  i would like it if the price was less. however i am deciding to get rid of mine :(<br />
<br />
<br />
SELLING my 100ml bottle for WAYYY less than retail and discounters.       :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1794342"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1794342#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1793048" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1793048" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BlondePandora"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700226"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BlondePandora" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1793048ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1793048" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700226">BlondePandora</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-26">03/26/23 09:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Neroli Portofino smells like idealized summer in a bottlenot summer as it really is (hot, suffocatingly humid) but summer as it is in your mind when it has not yet arrived. You're dreaming of the carefree days soon to come but steadfastly refusing to think about mosquitos, sweltering heat, sunburn, or sticking to car seats. <br />
<br />
Neroli Portofino gives sparkling aqua accords, plus an array of juicy citrus fruits, rich and redolent neroli flowers, and bright sunshine. It smells clean, fresh, lush, juicy, elegant, breezy, sweet but not too sweet. Again, its summer in a bottle! <br />
<br />
With a generous application, this has decent sillage on me even six hours after dry down, and it lasts better than any other citrus scent Ive tried. I still smelled it clearly on my wrists 20 hours after spritzing, though it no longer projected. For a citrus fragrance, such longevity is outstanding. Love it!<br />
<br />
But I dont love the price. I cant blame anyone for seeking dupes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1793048"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1793048#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1790325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1790325" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zecatburglar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699768"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1699768.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zecatburglar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1790325ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1790325" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699768">zecatburglar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-22">03/22/23 22:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a fragrance that activates the memory part of my brain. It instantly takes me back to when I was a young boy, happiest he will ever be. No responsibilities, simply living life to its fullest. Small enough to climb the orange tree and smell the blossoming flowers that he wont smell again for a long time until one day he decides to try a very beautiful looking perfume bottle at a Nordstrom. The bright citrusy flower scent hits me with a huge wave of nostalgia so for me personally I can look past the price tag. It was also my first expensive fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1790325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1790325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1781593" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1781593" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clairescentience"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1554949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="clairescentience" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Ocean-di-Gioia-59809.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59809.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ocean di Gioia"title="Ocean di Gioia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1781593ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1781593" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1554949">clairescentience</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-12">03/12/23 06:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Look, this smells nice. But the FACT this is an EDP and comes at $$$ price tag is an absolute scam to me. This is a baby cologne. People who are happy with this are people who have the money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1781593"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1781593#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1779447" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1779447" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Apaolone04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1596253.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Apaolone04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Omnia-Profumi/Madera-9534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madera"title="Madera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1779447ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1779447" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253">Apaolone04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-09">03/09/23 15:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first time I smelled this I was head over heels. I love aquatic fragrances and I thought this one had a uniqueness to it that I couldnt really explain, also a bit nostalgic. One day my sister came into my room and started smelling my perfumes, she picked up this one and said oh that smells like desitin (which is a brand of diaper rash cream my mom used on us and our siblings when we were little). She absolutely ruined the fragrance for me lol I cant get that smell out of my head now, it smells nothing aquatic to me anymore just powdery, clean, neroli. This also happens to be my boyfriends favorite scent on me out of my collection of 40+ perfumes so I will continue to wear it for him, but will feel like a fresh diaper when doing so.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1779447"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1779447#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1777093" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1777093" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="liam04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1698566"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1698566.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="liam04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1777093ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1777093" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1698566">liam04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-07">03/07/23 03:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Literally smells like a mandarin, I mean, obviously right? <br />
<br />
This fragrance by Tom Ford, even when disliked, has been praised and named a great creation and represents the unapologetic nature of Tom Ford fragrances. Honestly, I acknowledge that everything is subjective but I wouldn't even agree with that. Neroli dominates the nose which does provide a fresh scent, but I could not imagine going to this on a regular basis. Perhaps it's just not for me, but I wouldn't be caught dead buying a bottle of this for the hefty pricepoint Tom Ford offers, especially considering that it completely disappeared off of my skin within about 5 hours.<br />
If you're a fan of the fruity and citrus scents, there's way better for way cheaper, there are even way better Neroli fragrances out there to opt for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1777093"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1777093#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1775242" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1775242" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dabeyondobsessedemperor"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1582152"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1582152.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dabeyondobsessedemperor" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Celine/Black-Tie-57925.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57925.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Tie"title="Black Tie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1775242ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1775242" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1582152">dabeyondobsessedemperor</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-04">03/04/23 20:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very citrus forward--honestly, to my nose, it's nothing particularly special. Perhaps it just isn't my cup of tea, or it doesn't blend well with my skin, but I could potentially see others enjoying this scent. It's got a slightly soapy vibe to it that's commendable, but there's just an undertone that simply doesn't mesh well with me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1775242"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1775242#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1774244" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1774244" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mr sniffer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1698445"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1698445.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mr sniffer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1774244ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1774244" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1698445">mr sniffer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-03">03/03/23 15:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one is my wife's but I've also tried it. Wifey loves it even more than me. She says it smells like "money" and "metal." No idea what she's talking about tbh.<br />
<br />
I never thought unisex perfumes were any good, but this one changed my mind on that. And it truly is unisex. Not too floral or musky. Which can be a pro or a con depending what you're looking for.<br />
<br />
My first impression was pretty meh. It smelled a bit like a potpourri and not a personal scent. BUT you have to let it drydown and it really improves a lot. I actually don't think the accords listed give the right impression. To me there is a lot of aqua/marine. But the fresh/clean citrusy accords are correct.<br />
<br />
As a man, I'd personally prefer to wear a more masculine scent. Other than that, it's a great fragrance and has great balance. For me, it's a 8/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1774244"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1774244#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1773357" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1773357" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MOSRUS"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1525194"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1525194.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MOSRUS" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Terre-d-Hermes-Eau-Givree-72439.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72439.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Terre d'Hermes Eau Givree"title="Terre d'Hermes Eau Givree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1773357ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1773357" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1525194">MOSRUS</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-02">03/02/23 14:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow. I am usually not very interested in fresh fragrances, but this one blew me away. Something about it reminded me of my childhood, and I love it so much. It smells like a soap, but a really nice soap. Smells like those hard natural soaps grandmas use in eastern europe. It smells clean, soapy, with hints of florals which make the perfume smell beautiful.<br />
<br />
I haven't smellt 4711, but if it comes close to this, then I might need to buy it instead of opting for this expensive fragrance.<br />
<br />
In the office this works amazing, however in the summer this is another beast. <br />
<br />
This is not your compliment getter, if you are into that sort of thing. I did get some compliments here and there, but it is not your JPG or something else from the Tom Ford exclusive blend line.<br />
<br />
Overall the scent is amazing, it lasts for 2 hours, and I love it, that's pretty much it.<br />
<br />
Don't blind buy, but try this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1773357"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1773357#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1773116" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; A good, green freshie for the warmer months. Gives 'clean girl', for the people that aren't into the musk of Glossier's You</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12192"comment_id="1773116"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Neroli-Portofino-12192.html?ccid=1773116#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1764562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
